text: Curriculum Vitae PERSONAL INFORMATION Name: <NAME>: 5654933 Addres 250 ol Hal EDUCATION Bachelor Degree: Central University of Finance and Economics , Beijing , China, 2006- 2010 Bachelor of Economics , Majoring in International Economics and Trade (Direction of Financial Risk Manageme nt) Overall GPA : 86/100 Major GPA : 90/100 Expected Master Degree: Rice University , Houston, TX, USA, 2013 -Expected Spring 2014 Master of Statistics , Majoring in Statistics Current GPA : 4.11/4.33 GRE (General): Verbal: 640/800 (92%); Math: 800/800 (94%); Writing: 3.5/5 TOEFL iBT: Reading: 28; Listening: 26; Speaking: 24; Writing: 25 WORKING EXP ERIENCES Jiyuhai Investment Consulting Company Limited , Beijing , 2009- 2010 Internship: Margin Account Trader  Trained in international spot gold trading Suzhoujie Sub- branch, China Everbright Bank , Beijing , 2010- 2011 Corporate Client Manager  Marketing and maintaining corporate clients ;  assisting corporate loan supervision ;  Drawn over fifty million Yuan of personal deposit s in international financing services between academies;  Responsible for project of life and annuity of Caterpillar Inc. (China) ;  Responsible for Hainan Airlines ’ Merge and Acquisition loan. EDUCATIONAL EXPERIENCES Grader : STAT 280 , Rice University, Fall 2013 Related Rice University Coursework :  Overview of Mathematical Statistics , Introduction to Regression and Statistical Computing , Applied Time Series and Forecasting, Quantitative Financial Analytics , Statistical Computing and Graphics (R Programming), Advanced Statistical Methods, Curriculum Vitae Quantitative Financial Risk Management, Market Models, Introduction to Random Processes and Applications Notable Rice University Class Project s  Estimated returns and volatilities of assets using ARIMA, GARCH models.  Applying MCMC method to simulate stochastic volatility .  Simulated and back tested several stock investing strategies, Dogs of The Dow, Buy And Hold , MaxMedian, etc, using R Programming Language.  Gained experience in analyzing corporate financial reports. Constructed hypothetical portfolios applying various market models , VaR, CAPM , etc, in lieu of the virtual market environment .  Explored data and w rote a report on Global Terrorism Data base, 104,611 observations dealt with using R.  Explored data and wrote a report on National Survey of Family Growth Database, 21,332 records dealt with in R.
